channel.title: Energy on DistributedFog
channel.description: Recent content in Energy on DistributedFog

item.title: Energy Harvesting
item.description:
Energy harvesting or scavenging is the process by which ambient energy is derived from external sources, captured, and stored for small, wireless autonomous devices. Wikipedia Research Parametric Excitation, Energy Harvesting Technologies Book, Wireless Energy Harvesting, Comparison
Makers Solar Harvesting Project, Pieze, Wurth, Energy Harvesting Designs for the IoT
All processes that involve energy conversion are, to some degree, inefficient. Motors get hot, as do power transistors, automobile engines, and light bulbs; in each case energy is wasted as heat.

item.title: Wireless Charging
item.description:
Wireless Charging provides a convenient, safe, and reliable way to charge and power electrical devices, IoT sensors and devices, at home, in the workplace and in industry. powerbyproxi.com Research Comparing WiTricity and Inductive Coupling History and Future of Wireless Charging, Transport: Inductive Charging for EVs
Although inductive charging with an induction coil is the most common form of wireless charging, uBeam is pioneering an ultrasound method, HumaVox uses near-field radio frequency resonance and WiTricity uses Magnetic Resonance.
